data.title: Things To Do In Valdosta, Georgia
data.meta_description: From theme park thrills to outdoor adventure, there’s lots to keep you entertained on a visit to this college town.
data.text:
When it comes to college towns in the state of Georgia, some spots get all of the love. One lesser-sung place deserves more of your attention, though, and that’s Valdosta. (It’s pronounced Val-dah-stah, for those of you who haven’t heard of it before.) Located in South Georgia, just a stone’s throw from the Georgia-Florida border, it’s home to Valdosta State University (Go Blazers), as well as a concentration of shops and restaurants, more than enough to fill up a weekend trip. Plus, you’re sure to receive a warm welcome, because this lively mid-size city has a fun small-town atmosphere to match. From an exciting day spent at a high-energy amusement park to delicious meals and a stay in a newly reimagined boutique hotel, you’ll love a visit to Valdosta.

Take a Walk on the Wild Side at Wild Adventures

Billed as “170 acres of rides, slides and exotic animals,” Wild Adventures is a theme park and water park with a ton of fun attractions just a short drive from Valdosta proper. Roller coasters, kids’ rides, holiday shows, and concerts round out the experience at this regional-favorite park.

Enjoy Fresh Seafood at The Salty Snapper

This oyster bar moonlights as a live music venue. On the menu, you can order fish tacos, shrimp and grits, crab cakes, and a seafood boil complete with pickled okra. Find it on Gornto Road near Sugar Creek.

Have a Memorable Meal at 306 North

This restaurant makes it home in Valdosta’s historic district, and it’s a great spot for an upscale meal, with appetizers like fried green tomatoes and braised pork belly opening onto entrees like pork chops, ahi tuna, and eggplant parmesan.

Try Local Brews at Georgia Beer Company

Known as South Georgia’s first brewery and taproom of its kind, as well as the southernmost brewery in the state, Georgia Beer Company is a destination for IPAs, stouts, lagers, and ales. You can find canned beers like Field Party, a blonde ale, and Southern Isles, a tropical IPA, on offer, plus rotating seasonal selections.

See the Local Fauna at Grand Bay Wildlife Management Area

If you’d like to explore in the outdoors, check out Grand Bay Wildlife Management Area. Here, you’ll find nature trails, hiking trails, and canoe access. The property itself is broad. According to the Georgia Department of Natural Resources, “The WMA consists of approximately 3,059 acres of upland pine and hardwood forest and 5,438 acres of cypress/gum wetlands. There are two main access points: the check station/education center entrance on Knight’s Academy Road. and the federal land entrance off U.S. Highway 221.”

Catch A Show With Peach State Summer Theatre

If you visit Valdosta in the summer, try to catch a show put on by Peach State Summer Theatre, the area’s premiere summer stock theater company. Performances happen on the campus of Valdosta State University where, “each summer, a company of some 60 actor-singers, dancers, technicians, managers, and creators will reside in Valdosta for a ten-week season. During that time, they will rehearse, build and present three musicals in rotating repertory,” according to VSU.

Book A Stay at The McKey

Valdosta’s favorite new boutique hotel is The McKey, which is located downtown in a beautifully restored space with light and airy rooms that showcase views of the town’s historic architecture. According to The McKey, “Locally owned and operated by Daniel and Kyndal Bayman, The McKey Building was originally built in 1906 by brothers T.S. McKey and W.H. McKey. Purchased in June of 2021, The McKey was under renovations for two years and converted from a church and office space to twelve timeless rooms, an elegant event space, and a cozy coffee shop.”

See Art At The Annette Howell Turner Center for the Arts

Stop by the Turner Center for the Arts to see works of art in the space’s several galleries, which show permanent and temporary exhibitions by artists both from the surrounding region and farther afield.

Ride A Wave At The Valdosta Wake Compound

If your idea of a good time involves catching some air on the water, set your sights on The Valdosta Wake Compound, which invites visitors (novices and experts alike) to wakeboard and wakeskate at their facility on Old Clyattville Road.
